title: Authors and Citation
text: Johan Aparicio. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aparicio J (2024). exploreHTP: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {exploreHTP: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data},   author = {Johan Aparicio},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: exploreHTP designed assist researchers plant breeders efficiently exploring analyzing data derived drone imagery. package offers suite tools tailored unique needs plant breeding data, facilitating comprehensive data exploration, correlation analysis, data manipulation. Key functionalities include: Data Exploration: Simplified methods visualizing manipulating large datasets high throughput phenotyping. Correlation Analysis: Tools calculate correlations different traits across multiple time points, providing insights trait relationships temporal dynamics. Modeling Canopy Evolution: Advanced functionalities modeling predicting canopy growth development time.

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: can install development version exploreHTP GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("AparicioJohan/exploreHTP")

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: basic example shows use exploreHTP:
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato  results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long" plot(results, type = "evolution") head(results$summ_traits)

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
code: # Trait by Time table <- plot(results, label_size = 4, signif = TRUE, n_row = 1) head(table)

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
code: # Time by Trait table <- plot(results, type = "time_by_trait", label_size = 4, signif = TRUE) head(table)

what: 4. Estimating days to emergence and days to full canopy

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
text: function performs canopy modelling based time series data high-throughput phenotyping (HTP). optimizes parameters fit specified function canopy data time, potentially correcting maximum values adding zero point series.

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
code: canopy_HTP(   results,   canopy = "Canopy",   plot_id = NULL,   correct_max = TRUE,   add_zero = TRUE,   method = c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms"),   return_method = FALSE,   parameters = c(t1 = 45, t2 = 80),   fn = fn_sse_can )

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
text: results object class exploreHTP, containing results read_HTP() function. canopy string specifying canopy trait modeled. Default "Canopy". plot_id optional vector plot IDs filter data. Default NULL, meaning plots used. correct_max Logical. TRUE, adds maximum value reaching local maximum. Default TRUE. add_zero Logical. TRUE, adds zero value time series. Default TRUE. method character vector optimization methods used, specified optimx package. Default c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms"). return_method Logical. TRUE, includes selected optimization method output table. Default FALSE. parameters named vector specifying initial values parameters optimized. Default c(t1 = 45, t2 = 80). fn function minimized (maximized), first argument vector parameters minimization take place. return scalar result. Default fn_sse_can.

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
text: list two elements: param data frame containing optimized parameters related information. dt data frame corrected possibly zero-augmented canopy data.

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long"          out <- canopy_HTP(   results = results,   canopy = "Canopy",   plot_id = c(22, 40),   correct_max = TRUE,   add_zero = TRUE ) names(out) #> [1] "param" "dt"    plot(out, c(22, 40))  out$param$deltaT <- out$param$t2 - out$param$t1 out$param$slope <- out$param$max / out$param$deltaT out$param #> # A tibble: 2 × 10 #>    plot genotype    row range    t1    t2   max   sse deltaT slope #>   <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1    22 W17047-5      8     2  39.5  75.6  98.9 0.371   36.1  2.74 #> 2    40 W17043-37    12     3  34.9  61.8 100   0.162   26.9  3.72

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_model
text: Canopy Modelling

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_model
code: canopy_model(   results,   canopy = "Canopy",   plot_id = NULL,   method = FALSE,   correct_max = TRUE,   add_zero = TRUE )

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_model
text: results Object class exploreHTP canopy string plot_id Optional Plot ID. NULL default method TRUE FALSE. see method used optimization table. FALSE default. correct_max Add maximum value reaching local maximum. TRUE default. add_zero TRUE FALSE. Add zero time series.TRUE default.

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_model
text: data.frame

title: Drone Data in Potato — dt_potato
text: Vegetative indices biomass related traits potato trial arranged p-rep design.

title: Drone Data in Potato — dt_potato
code: dt_potato

title: Drone Data in Potato — dt_potato
text: tibble 1372 rows 17 variables: Trial chr trial name DAP dbl denoting Days planting Plot dbl denoting unique plot id Row dbl denoting row coordinate Range dbl denoting range coordinate Gen chr denoting genotype id Yield dbl Total Yield measured end season VineMaturity dbl VineMaturity measure season Red - Canopy dbl denoting drone-derived traits

title: Drone Data in Potato — dt_potato
text: UW - Potato Breeding Program

title: Piece-wise Regression — fn_canopy
text: Piece-wise Regression

title: Piece-wise Regression — fn_canopy
code: fn_canopy(t, t1 = 45, t2 = 80, k = 0.9)

title: Piece-wise Regression — fn_canopy
text: t Numeric. time value. t1 Numeric. lower threshold time. Default 45. t2 Numeric. upper threshold time. Default 80. k Numeric. maximum value function. Default 0.9.

title: Piece-wise Regression — fn_canopy
text: numeric value based threshold model. t less t1, function returns 0. t t1 t2 (inclusive), function returns value 0 k linear trend. t greater t2, function returns k.

title: Piece-wise Regression — fn_canopy
code: library(exploreHTP) x <- seq(0, 108, 0.1) y_hat <- sapply(x, FUN = fn_canopy, t1 = 34.9, t2 = 61.8, k = 100) plot(x, y_hat, type = "l") lines(x, y_hat, col = "red") abline(v = c(34.9, 61.8), lty = 2)

title: Exponential Exponential Function — fn_exp_exp
text: Computes value based double exponential model time.

title: Exponential Exponential Function — fn_exp_exp
code: fn_exp_exp(t, t1, t2, alpha, beta)

title: Exponential Exponential Function — fn_exp_exp
text: t Numeric. time value. t1 Numeric. lower threshold time. t2 Numeric. upper threshold time. alpha Numeric. parameter first exponential term. Must greater 0. beta Numeric. parameter second exponential term. Must less 0.

title: Exponential Exponential Function — fn_exp_exp
text: numeric value based double exponential model. t less t1, function returns 0. t t1 t2 (inclusive), function returns exp(alpha * (t - t1)^2) - 1. t greater t2, function returns (exp(alpha * (t2 - t1)^2) - 1) * exp(beta * (t - t2)).

title: Exponential Linear Function — fn_exp_linear
text: Computes value based exponential linear model time.

title: Exponential Linear Function — fn_exp_linear
code: fn_exp_linear(t, t1, t2, alpha, beta)

title: Exponential Linear Function — fn_exp_linear
text: t Numeric. time value. t1 Numeric. lower threshold time. t2 Numeric. upper threshold time. alpha Numeric. parameter exponential term. Must greater 0. beta Numeric. parameter linear term. Must less 0.

title: Exponential Linear Function — fn_exp_linear
text: numeric value based exponential linear model. t less t1, function returns 0. t t1 t2 (inclusive), function returns exp(alpha * (t - t1)^2) - 1. t greater t2, function returns beta * (t - t2) + (exp(alpha * (t2 - t1)^2) - 1).

title: Sum of Squares Error Function — fn_sse_can

title: Plant Height Modelling — height_HTP
text: Plant Height Modelling

title: Plant Height Modelling — height_HTP
code: height_HTP(   results,   canopy,   plant_height = "PH",   plot_id = NULL,   add_zero = TRUE,   method = c("lbfgsb3c", "pracmanm", "anms"),   return_method = FALSE,   parameters = c(t2 = 67, alpha = 1/600, beta = -1/80),   fn = fn_sse_exp )

title: Plant Height Modelling — height_HTP
text: results Object class exploreHTP canopy Object class canopy_HTP plant_height string plot_id Optional Plot ID. NULL default add_zero TRUE FALSE. Add zero time series.TRUE default. method vector methods used, character string. See optimx package. c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms") default. return_method TRUE FALSE. return method selected optimization table. FALSE default. parameters (Optional)    Initial values parameters optimized . c(45, 80) default. fn function minimized (maximized), first argument vector parameters minimization take place. return scalar result. Default fn_sse_exp.

title: Plant Height Modelling — height_HTP
text: data.frame

title: Plant Height Modelling — height_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long"          out <- canopy_HTP(   results = results,   canopy = "Canopy",   plot_id = c(22, 40),   correct_max = TRUE,   add_zero = TRUE ) names(out) #> [1] "param" "dt"    plot(out, c(22, 40))  out$param #> # A tibble: 2 × 8 #>    plot genotype    row range    t1    t2   max   sse #>   <dbl> <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1    22 W17047-5      8     2  39.5  75.6  98.9 0.371 #> 2    40 W17043-37    12     3  34.9  61.8 100   0.162

what: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
title: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: Creates various plots object class read_HTP. Depending specified type, function can generate plots show correlations traits time, correlations time points trait, evolution traits time.

title: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
code: # S3 method for read_HTP plot(   x,   type = "trait_by_time",   label_size = 4,   signif = FALSE,   method = "pearson",   filter_trait = NULL,   n_row = NULL,   n_col = NULL,   base_size = 13,   return_gg = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: x object inheriting class read_HTP, resulting executing function read_HTP(). type Character string specifying type plot generate. Available options : "trait_by_time" Plots correlations traits time (default). "time_by_trait" Plots correlations time points trait. "evolution" Plots evolution traits time. label_size Numeric. Size labels plot. Default 4. signif Logical. TRUE, adds p-values correlation plot labels. Default FALSE. method Character string specifying method correlation calculation. Available options "pearson" (default), "spearman", "kendall". filter_trait Character vector specifying traits exclude plot. n_row Integer specifying number rows use facet_wrap(). Default NULL. n_col Integer specifying number columns use facet_wrap(). Default NULL. base_size Numeric. Base font size plot. Default 13. return_gg Logical. TRUE, returns ggplot object instead printing . Default FALSE. ... graphical parameters future improvements.

title: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: ggplot object invisible data.frame containing correlation table type "trait_by_time" "time_by_trait".

title: Plot an Object of Class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) table <- plot(results, label_size = 4, signif = TRUE, n_row = 2)  table #> # A tibble: 7 × 7 #>    time col    row    corr  p.value     n signi #>   <dbl> <fct>  <fct> <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <fct> #> 1    36 Canopy PH     0.47 7.78e-11   176 ***   #> 2    42 Canopy PH     0.67 4.50e-27   196 ***   #> 3    56 Canopy PH    -0.18 1.16e- 2   196 *     #> 4    76 Canopy PH     0.31 8.89e- 6   196 ***   #> 5    92 Canopy PH     0.27 1.32e- 4   196 ***   #> 6   100 Canopy PH     0.31 1.38e- 5   196 ***   #> 7   108 Canopy PH     0.07 3.37e- 1   196 ns    plot(results, type = "time_by_trait", label_size = 4, signif = TRUE)

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
text: Reads processes high-throughput phenotyping (HTP) data data frame wide format.

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
code: read_HTP(data, genotype, time, plot, traits, row, range)

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
text: data data.frame wide format containing HTP data. genotype character string indicating column `data` contains genotype information. time character string indicating column `data` contains time points. plot character string indicating column `data` contains plot IDs. traits character vector specifying columns `data` contain traits analyzed. row character string indicating column `data` contains row coordinates. range character string indicating column `data` contains range coordinates.

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
text: object class read_HTP, list containing following elements: summ_traits data.frame containing summary statistics trait time point, including minimum, mean, median, maximum, standard deviation, coefficient variation, number non-missing values, percentage missing values, percentage negative values. exp_design_resum data.frame summarizing experimental design, including number unique genotypes, rows, ranges, replication structure. locals_min_max data.frame containing local minima maxima mean trait values time. dt_long data.frame long format, columns time, plot, row, range, genotype, trait, value.

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
text: function processes prepares HTP data analyzed.

title: Read HTP Data — read_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long"           head(results$summ_traits) #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>   trait   time    Min  Mean Median   Max    SD       CV     n  miss `miss%` #>   <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <int> <int>   <dbl> #> 1 Canopy    29  0      0      0      0    0    NaN        196     0       0 #> 2 Canopy    36  0      2.86   1.77  14.5  3.12   1.09     196     0       0 #> 3 Canopy    42  0.731 22.7   22.3   44.1  9.00   0.397    196     0       0 #> 4 Canopy    56 32.8   74.0   73.7   99.2 12.2    0.165    196     0       0 #> 5 Canopy    76 89.6   99.7  100    100    1.05   0.0105   196     0       0 #> 6 Canopy    92 63.1   97.1   98.5  100.   4.24   0.0436   196     0       0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: `neg%` <dbl> plot(results, label_size = 4, signif = TRUE, n_row = 2)
